message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of drawing planar graphs with few segments on a grid, which is a topic in computational geometry (cs.CG). The use of a polynomial size grid suggests that the authors are interested in efficient algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The study of monotone drawings of graphs is related to the theory of graph drawing (cs.DM). The paper also involves the analysis of graph properties such as 3-connectivity and outerplanarity, which are topics in graph theory (cs.GT). Finally, the use of visual representations of graphs suggests a possible connection to information visualization (cs.SI).
